description: Reflexed sedge (Carex retroflexa) is an amazing species of plant due to its hardy nature. Adaptable to most environments and growing conditions, reflexed sedge can thrive in low-fertility soils, resist drought, and withstand temperatures ranging from -40°F to 140°F. The plant is also attractive to wildlife; its wiry stems and bright yellow-green catkins attract birds, while its foliage provides cover for nesting wildlife. Furthermore, the plant's ability to spread rapidly via rhizomes makes it a great choice for wetland restoration and erosion control. Reflexed sedge is truly a remarkable species with hardiness and beauty.
